fields.description:
In Confluence, when using the [Jira macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-issues-macro-139380.html] in order to create a new issue in Jira, if you select the issue type to be a *Epic* one, you are able to link it to a *Epic Name*.

However, when changing the issue type to be other (e.g. Story, Tasks), it will not have a field allowing the user to associate the same with an epic. For some users, when an epic name is required for the same issue type, it can be a toilsome work to manually add it in Jira, after creating it from Confluence. 

This is a suggestion to allow the *Epic Name* field to be displayed using different issue types in Confluence's Jira macro.
fields.summary: Display Epic Fields for Different Issue Types in Jira Macro

fields.description:
In Confluence, some features/content will depend on it getting refreshed to properly display on Confluence pages. For some customers, it would be great if we could have such pages automatically refreshed. 

This is a suggestion to provide a bundled option on the application in order to select specific pages to be refreshed.
fields.summary: Option to Automatically Refresh/Reload an Specific Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the new look of Confluence, users can automatically collapse the sidebar which makes it difficult to navigate through blog posts.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option in-line with the blog post content that allows users to navigate "next" and "previous" through blog posts.
fields.summary: Include navigation options for blog post in-line

fields.description:
*Summary*

The image in the word document is not imported after being import to confluence page.


*Steps to replicate*

# Create word document and add Smart art to the word file.
# Import the word document to confluence page


*Observed behavior*

The word file is imported successfully but the image/smart art is missing.


*Expected behavior*

The image/ smart art should be seen on confluence page.
fields.summary: Image/Smart art missing after importing word file

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing preformatted text in a table, the cell colour cannot be changed. Also, cell cannot be set to responsive or fixed-width.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test page in Confluence.
 # Insert a table and add some test in one of the cells.
 # Change the text formatting to Preformatted.

h3. Expected Results
 * The cell colour should be editable.
 * The cell should be editable to Responsive or Fixed-width.

h3. Actual Results
 * Unable to change the cell colour.
 * Unable to change the cell to Responsive or Fixed-width.
 !Preformatted.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Move cursor outside the preformatted element.
fields.summary: Unable to change table options when cursor is in preformatted text in a table

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce:
 # Upload a large excel file with more than 500 rows
 # Click on the attachments to view

h3. Expected Behaviour
All data is visible.

h3. Actual Behaviour
Data gets truncated. <5000 rows.

h3. Workaround
Split the file
fields.summary: The excel spreadsheet gets truncated when it has more than 5000 rows in preview mode.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * View a page in space A
 * Copy that page -> editor is opened
 * Change location to another space
 * Click publish

Error flag appears : "Unable to Communicate with Server"

Can not publish the page.

The request to save page returns error 500: _\{"statusCode":500,"message":"java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Can't add a parent from another space."}_
fields.summary: Can not copy page to another space

fields.description: Running Confluence Site Import doesn't clean up all the data before importing and might leave Comments or Pages that existed before the import.
fields.summary: Confluence Site Import Does Not Clean All the Data

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When opening links in IOS Mobile to Confluence Cloud blog posts from a URL taken from the Desktop version of the site like this https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JLON/blog/2017/12/19/8454145/Mobile+Test+post , the user will be redirected incorrectly to a URL like:
https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=-1#content/view/-1

Browsing to the page in the UI gives a link like:
https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/mobile#content/view/8454145

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
 - IOS (this happens is Chrome and Safari, and will prevent redirects to the Confluence Application)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have access to a normal blog post link from the desktop. I used https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JLON/blog/2017/12/19/8454145/Mobile+Test+post
# Attempt to access that link from an IOS device, such as an IPhone or IPad.

h3. Expected Results

The user is redirected to the expected page normally.

h3. Actual Results
User is instead redirected to a link like:
https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=-1#content/view/-1

and they get the error message:
{noformat}
That page ID is invalid. Page IDs can only contain numbers. Double-check the URL and give it another shot.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This issue does not seem to impact Android devices.

h3.Workaround
You can reach the page if you browse directly to it. This also does not impact normal Confluence Pages, only blog posts.
fields.summary: Links to Blog posts will not properly redirect in mobile browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem
- We need to know which pages had their page restrictions changed, at the moment we were able to see which pages are restricted but we are unable to see when restrictions are changed.

h3. Solution
- Add an audit log of when Page Restrictions are changed in a page
- Add a report for all pages restricted for single users

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Audit Log Page Restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* When editing a page in Confluence, if you copy a table in it and paste it, the pasted content will be only the text of the table, not its structure.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Add a table
# Select the table and copy it
# Paste the content

h3. Expected Results

* The table should be in the structure as it was copied.

h3. Actual Results

* Only the content of the table is copied in the form of text. !Screen Shot 2017-12-19 at 18.19.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

* Copy the original table from the published page and paste it on the edit.
fields.summary: Copy table in Confluence Editor copies only the text, not the table's structure

fields.description:
When creating JIRA issues from a table on a Confluence page, all of the issues go into JIRA unassigned. In addition to being able to select a column for Summary and Description fields, it would be great to have an Assignee field as well so that I could select a column that contained the Assignees of each issue. 

!image-2017-12-19-11-59-07-502.png!
fields.summary: Add Assignee Field When Creating JIRA Issues from Table in Confluence Pg

fields.description:
I've tried to integrate Invision in Atlassian Confluence, but to no avail:

Upon installation of the add-on, it should embed an Invision shared link.
That's not working for me, not for both shared link - concepts apparantly in use:

[https://in.invisionapp.com/share/VDF1M9THB] (the old link build-up it appears)
[https://invis.io/VDF1M9THB#/270219902_Home] (the new link build-up)
fields.summary: Invision embed not working with new share URLs in Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking the "Confluence" logo (page top left) link is not working in Firefox and IE11. Additionally, hovering the mouse over the logo in Firefox does not show "Confluence" written.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Click the Confluence logo (page top left) in Firefox and/or IE11 in an instance. 
* Depending on where you are, you may be linked to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates or https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work

h3. Expected Results
* Being on Activity > clicking the logo > https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates
* Being on Your work > clicking the logo > https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work
* Being on Spaces > clicking the logo > https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work
* Being on People > clicking the logo > https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work
* Being on Settings > clicking the logo > https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work

h3. Actual Results
* Being on Activity > clicking the logo > nothing happens 
* Being on Your work > clicking the logo > nothing happens
* Being on Spaces > clicking the logo > nothing happens
* Being on People > clicking the logo > nothing happens
* Being on Settings > clicking the logo > nothing happens

h3.Workaround
* Click the "Switch apps" icon (three horizontal bars at the left bottom) > Confluence.
fields.summary: Clicking Confluence logo not working in Firefox/IE11

fields.description:
- Install RefinedSpaces for Confluence
 - In the Confluence settings select Refined Spaces configuration in the left menu and select Themes.
 - Create a new theme with a full backgroundImage
 - Go to a space and select Space tools > Theming and change theme to the newly created.
 - Disable Refined Space's Space Home with the toggle button
 - Go to Overview (notice that Text is displayed on top of background image, see attached)

Expected look should be similar with Pages/Blog

!Overview.png|width=500,height=285,thumbnail!     !Blog.png|width=500,height=285,thumbnail!

 

For more details, please see: [DEVHELP-846|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-846]
fields.summary: Make Space Overview consistently have a white background

fields.description:
Hi

I am red/green (at least) colour blind and I'm having a hard time distinguish the default cell colours from eachother in Confluence. As an example; we have a few support matrixes that shows what version of a specific OS version goes together with other softwares, this is often represented by red, yellow and green cell colours in a matrix.

My thinking is that by implementing a "Colour blind switch" in the User settings area, it could be possible to have those washy default colours to be replaced by more clearer and richer representation of red. yellow and green for us colour blind people.

Regards
Robert Nilsson
fields.summary: Colour blind switch in profile

fields.description:
With the rollout of the new Editor, some keyboard shortcuts have changed. These changes can impact in the daily work of users that were used to the previous shortcuts for Confluence.

Allowing users to customize the shortcuts would avoid this impact and improve the editor experience by allowing these changes in a way that better suits the user needs.
h1.
fields.summary: Allow users to customize the keyboard shortcuts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you are viewing a question in Questions for Confluence, there is a list of Related Questions on the right side. If you open any of these links by clicking on it, it will open the link in the current tab. When it does this, Answers are not shown.

Clicking the link normally will load the question in the current page, seemingly in-place without reloading the page.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View any question in Questions for Confluence that has populated "Related Questions".
# left-click a related question link and open in the same tab (note that the question opened must have an existing answer to observe the effect.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads in the current tab showing all relevant data.

h3. Actual Results
The Answer is opened showing only the question, and no answers.

h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
Right-click the link of the question that you would like to jump to and open in new tab to view the question.
Alternatively, you can reload the page once you have opened the desired question in the same tab. Reloading will load in the answers as expected.
fields.summary: Related Questions links in Questions for Confluence do not display answers when opened in same tab

fields.description:
h6. Summary
Inconsistent Confluence Reports for labeled pages


h6. Steps to Reproduce
1. Add to the page Page properties report macro 
2. Publish the page
3. Refresh the page to see its content
4. Notice that the results displayed on the page are not consistent if you refresh the page, another number of records will be displayed

h6. Expected Results
The page should display all labeled pages.

h6. Actual Results
With each refresh, a different number of labeled pages are displayed. e.g. The first refresh of the report the number displayed is 279, later when the status page is refreshed the number rows in the report change to 145 and so on, the number of rows are not consistent at all.

h6. Notes

h6. Workaround
No known workaround so far.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Confluence Reports displayed for labeled pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Logging in to an instance that has anonymous access enabled as an anonymous user throws an unknown error in the front-end.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an instance with anonymous access enabled
# Log in anonymously

h3. Expected Results
Home page loads successfully

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown :
 com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.graphql.resource.ConfluenceGraphQLRestEndpoint	Error returned from query for operation '<unnamed>; 'Error code 403

h3. Notes
-Issue was observed on two instances (see below) both seem to have 3 add-ons in common, which might be the cause of this issue:-
* -Bob Swift Advanced Tables-
* -Lucidchart Diagrams and-
* -Copy Page Tree-

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Graphql Error when accessing Confluence as anonymous user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Atlassian detects that too many connections error is widely occurring on tenants.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
All reqeusts including long running tasks correctly work.

h3. Actual Results
Several functionalities are unavailable due to DB failure. Especially long running tasks such as Site Backup are affected.

h3.Workaround
* Since this is due to connection failure, retry can possibly be temporal solution
fields.summary: Too many connection error in DB causes a variety of functional outages
Web Panels in Confluence are loaded multiple times if you go to a Space Overview directly

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When exporting a page to a PDF that has special characters in it, the characters are not exported in the PDF (e.g. Chinese language, German characters, etc.)
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Create a page with Chinese characters on it. Example: 一周有七天
 # Export the page to PDF

h2. Expected Result

The Chinese characters should be shown on the PDF page.
h2. Current Result

The Chinese characters are missing from the PDF page.
h2. Workaround
 - Export the page to HTML, open the page, and print to PDF.
 - Upload the font file on Confluence's administration section: [Create a PDF in Another Language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-a-pdf-in-another-language-175473.html]
fields.summary: Export to PDF doesn't export special characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Some users wish to not only sort their spaces by last modified date but generate a report of it to check which spaces are not in use anymore.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Create an option to generate a report of the spaces that were last updated from within a time range.

h3. Why this is important

* This will allow users to keep their Confluence Cloud site updated, without unnecessary information which is not in use anymore.
fields.summary: Ability to Create Report of Confluence's Spaces by Last Modified Date

fields.description:
Currently, there isn't a documentation article that helps Administrators to manage other user's Personal Spaces.

There are some functions that can be restricted even to them, depending on how the Space's permissions are configured.

For example:

*How to Delete a Personal Space*

This is the current workaround to that:
 * Go to User Management
 * Look for the user and click on the name once you found it
 * Choose Login as user from the top-right corner
 * Go to this user's Personal Space and perform the deletion
fields.summary: Improve Documentation on Personal Spaces for Administrators

fields.description:
h3. `Summary

Pages with Several JIRA links display JDBC Exception
h3. Description

Some pages can display several JIRA Issue links through Macros (JIRA Issue Filter) and some of them - generally ones that display more than 150 JIRA Issues - can have JDBC problems.

In these cases, the JIRA Issue isn't displayed and a message like the one below is displayed on its place:
{code:java}
org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Unable to acquire JDBC Connection
{code}
h3. Workaround

Split macros/filters on other pages
fields.summary: Pages with Several JIRA links display JDBC Exception

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing a table in Confluence, you can create a new table row by hitting the "tab" key in the last cell.
If you do this such so that the new table row is created off-screen, the view is not focused to the new row and you cannot see that the row was created until you start typing.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table and resize the window such that the end of the table is at the bottom of the page.
# tab through cells until you are at the last cell
# hit tab again to create a new table row in the space that is currently off-screen.

h3. Expected Results

The row is created and the viewport is focused to bring the cursor into view.

h3. Actual Results
The new table row is created off-screen and the screen does not bring it into view.
 
h3. Notes
If you start typing after the row has been created, it will re-focus the viewport and bring the table row into view.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Creating new table row with tab does not get focus if new row is off-screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Images don't update to new version if they have image effects applied

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new page
# Add an image
# Set an image effect on the image
# In the attachments menu for the page, upload an identically named but different image
#Refresh page

h3. Expected Results
Image should be replaced

h3. Actual Results
Image stays at original version


h3.Workaround
Avoid using image effects
fields.summary: Images don't update to new versions if they have image effects applied

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Table of contents links with non-Latin characters in the headings do not work, i.e. opening them in a new tab will take you to the top of the list.  


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with headings containing words with non-standard Latin characters
# Add a table of contents macro.
# Copy the link to a section with non-standard Latin Characters in the Heading
# Open a new browser tab 
# Paste the link


h3. Expected Results
Page should open at the appropriate heading

h3. Actual Results
Page opens at the title
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Table of Content links with Non-Latin characters don't work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the new interface of Confluence Cloud, some users are experiencing difficulties regarding the screenshots of documentation and online videos showing the old interface while using the new one.

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the documentation and online videos with examples being shown on the new interface of Cloud.

h3. Why this is important
 
Customer's that are unfamiliar with the product will face obstacles on learning how to handle it.
fields.summary: Update Documentation and Videos to new interface

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Monospaced text markup \{{ }} is not working. Text inserted inside the markup won't be monospaced and the markup is still displayed.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Insert any text inside the \{{ }} markup on any page, eg.:
{noformat}
{{should be monospaced}}
{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

The text inserted inside the \{{ }} markup is monospaced and the markup characters are not displayed
h3. Actual Results

The text inserted inside the \{{ }} markup *is not* monospaced and the markup characters *are* displayed
h3. Workaround

Select the text and utilize the Style dropdown to select "Preformatted".
fields.summary: Monospaced text markup {{ }} not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing Confluence via Firefox or IE11 on Windows 10, the Home Button on the Sidebar does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to Confluence on Firefox or IE 11 on Windows10
# Navigate away from the home page
# Press the Home Button

h3. Expected Results
Pressing the Home Button Takes you to the home page

h3. Actual Results
Nothing Happens

h3.Workaround
None, other than using another browser
fields.summary: Confluence Home Button does not work on Firefox and IE11

fields.description:
*Summary*

PDF export file will not display text as italic in macro quote

 

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Add an italic text in a macro quote
 # Export the page as pdf
 # Notice that the exported page will display the text inside the macro quote as normal, but not italic

*Expected Results*

The exported file should display the text as italic.

*Actual Results*

Text inside a quote is exported.

*Notes*

This issue is present only for text inside a quote macro, the text outside the quote is exported in italic.

 

*Workaround*

No known workaround.
fields.summary: PDF export file will not display text as italic in macro quote

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Find&Replace feature of Confluence (CMD+Shift+H or CRTL H) if the word is inside a table, the menu to replace the word/go to the next one will be exchanged for the table menu, not allowing the user to continue the find and replace search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click to *Edit* a page
# Insert a table and random words inside it, so the user can search it later
# On the page editor, either click on the magnifying glass (top of the right side) or use the CMD+Shift+H/CRTL H keyboard shortcut to search for the word inside the table

h3. Expected Results

The Find&Replace menu should continue on the editor so the user can hit *Next* or *Previous* to go to the next/previous word.

h3. Actual Results
The Find&Replace menu will be replaced by the table menu since the cursor is moved to the table 

h3. Notes
After having the menu replaced, if the user clicks on the word inside the table and try to use the menu of find&replace again, it will be displayed, but, the table menu will not be displayed, which can affect on editing the table content later. Attached is a video called *editor.mp4* for the issue being reproduced.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Find and Replace Menu Disappears if the Content is inside a table

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the labels and likes are at the bottom of a page in Confluence, but some users prefer it to be at the top of the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to choose where the labels and likes are displayed
fields.summary: Provide ability to choose position of labels and likes

fields.description:
In Confluence, when a page does not have any labels, the following text is displayed, on the page:

!label.png|thumbnail!

By default, there is no option to hide the text, unless the user adds a new label, so the label would be displayed. This is a suggestion to either:

* Remove the *No Labels* when the page does not have any labels added
* Provide an option under the *Space Tools* to disable/enable it on the pages
fields.summary: Option to Hide Labels Field from Pages

fields.description: Include Waterfox Browser for Confluence Cloud instances.
fields.summary: Support Waterfox Browser for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the *Product Requirements* space blueprint, and adding a list variable in one of the cells from the tables of the blueprint, when the page is published the drop-down menu to choose a value is not being displayed.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new space
# Under *Space settings*, go to *Content Tools > Templates*
# Click on *Edit* in *Product Requirements*
# On the template, add a few variables in any of the cells on the tables of the template and choose its display value to *list* (or *text* or *multi-line text*) by clicking on top of the variable
# *Preview* the page, you will be able to see the dropdown menus from the list-variables
# *Save* the Template
# Create a page based on the recently edited template

h3.Expected Results
You would be able to see the page in edit mode, just as it was being displayed on the *Preview* at the time of editing of the template

h3.Actual Results
The cells where the drop-down menus are now empty.

h3. Workaround
Copy the contents of the Product Requirements template, create a new template and paste the contents there, using this one instead.
fields.summary: List variables in Product Requirements template not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to view spreadsheets on Confluence Mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence Mobile;
# Go to a page that has a spreadsheet;
# Click on the spreadsheet to visualize it.

h3. Expected Results
The spreadsheet opens.

h3. Actual Results
When clicking on the spreadsheet the application redirects to the mobile browser, where the user is only able to view the spreadsheet as an image.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at this moment
fields.summary: Its not possible to view spreadsheets on Confluence Mobile

fields.description:
*Summary*

Info, Tip, Note and Warning Macros inside a comment are not properly displayed. 

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Open a page
 # Add a comment
 # Add one of Info, Tip, Note, and Warning Macros inside the comment
 # Preview the page -> Notice that all the macros are properly displayed
 # Publish the page -> Notice that none of these marcos are not properly displayed 

*Expected Results*

We should be able to see the macros inside a comment properly displayed

*Actual Results*

Info, Tip, Note, and Warning Macros are not properly displayed.

 

*Notes*

This issue is present only after publishing the page, in Edit or Preview mode this is not reproducible.

 

*Workaround*

No known workaround.
fields.summary: Info, Tip, Note, and Warning Macros inside a comment are not properly displayed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting modified repeating events on a calendar will remove additional events as well even when you select to only delete *This instance only*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a repeating event on your calendar (Daily events for instance).
# Create a second repeating event on the same calendar with a different repeating frequency (Weekly for instance).
# Edit one of the 2nd repeating event and change the title for that specific event as well as its date.
# Repeat the same process on the next repeating event (the Weekly ones not the Daily ones).
# Delete one of the earlier Weekly event that was unmodified.
# Delete the first Weekly event that was modified.

h3. Expected Results
Events are properly deleted and the rest of the events are untouched.

h3. Actual Results
The events are properly deleted but the future Weekly events are also deleted (modified and unmodified ones).
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Team Calendar repeating events gets deleted even though you select "This instance only" during the deletion

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we add a JIRA Issue macro inside a expand macro, the filter doesn't work and displays this message:
"Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in JIRA."

 !Screen Shot 2017-12-12 at 6.17.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
(!) Confluence 1000.0.0-aa31a54c289

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a expand macro to a confluence page
# Add a JIRA Issue macro inside the expand macro
# Reload the page

h3. Expected Results
The JIRA Issue macro should display the filter's result

h3. Actual Results
Filter doesn't displays any results only the message below.
 
h3.Workaround
Place the JIRA Issue macro outside the expand macro.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro inside expand macro doesn't work

fields.description: Dupe of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58514
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro inside expand macro doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Find more results" link of the Content Report Table macro shows "Page Not Found" message.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create the Content Report Table macro inside a page. 
* Configure the macro to search for a label that generates results enough to show a "Find more results" link (it was tested with 21 page results).
* Click on the "Find more results".

h3. Expected Results
* The page will show a list of all the pages with the specified label.

h3. Actual Results
* It shows "Page Not Found" message below.

h3.Workaround
* Click to open the "Find more results" on another tab.
fields.summary: "Find more results" link of the Content Report Table macro shows "Page Not Found" message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user uses a file with several versions but only the oldest version will be shown in the actual page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Edit mode in the page
# Drag to select the image to update
# Open the "Insert files and images" window and drag&drop the new image with the same name.
# Publish

This procedure was confirmed by our customer since we can't reproduce this in other instances so far.

h3. Expected Results
User can find the new version of the file in the page.

h3. Actual Results
Only the oldest version will be shown.
 
h3. Notes
When you check the Attachments page, you can find two version trees associated to that file.
The "Properties" link of each tree leads to a same page.

h3.Workaround
No
fields.summary: Older version of a file is shown in the page and that file has several version trees

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Certain pages in Confluence Cloud is failing to load
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the affected pages, it will result in an empty page showing

h3. Expected Results
 * Pages will completely load and display

h3. Actual Results
 * Pages how nothing with the following error in the console

{noformat}
WARNING: heuristic fragment matching going on!
(anonymous) @ writeToStore.js:139
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Edit any page in the space.
 # Replace the pageID in the URL with the affected PageID.
 # Copy all contents and create a new page out of it.
fields.summary: Certain Pages in Confluence fail to render/load

We're using the wrong Jira logo in the inline issue create.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- Images are not being displayed on the page, also not on the attachments page, so we find these errors on Chrome's console
{code}
image:1 GET https://media-api.atlassian.io/file/d7957073-e499-4287-aca2-9f9e607f855a/image?mode=full-fit&client=ec6b3f59-1ee4-452e-afea-e5e67989e605&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJlYzZiM2Y1OS0xZWU0LTQ1MmUtYWZlYS1lNWU2Nzk4OWU2MDUiLCJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpmaWxlOmQ3OTU3MDczLWU0OTktNDI4Ny1hY2EyLTlmOWU2MDdmODU1YSI6WyJyZWFkIl19LCJleHAiOjE1MTExOTgyODEsIm5iZiI6MTUxMTE5NDkyMX0.-h0mJZRUXxfvtU0m1g5dmf4KU-QpTr2RKSeXpDjSk0g 403 (Forbidden)
{code}

- There's one error for each image not being displayed
{code}
{"error":{"code":"JwtAuthoriser:TokenExpiredError","title":"Token verification failed: jwt expired","href":"https://media-api.atlassian.io#UnauthorizedError"}}
{code}

h3. Environment
- Confluence 1000.0.0-9b86de62ef9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- The issue happens when the token is expired by a bug on the application, so we can't trigger it
- The token gets expired and Confluence reach for an invalid information on the cache of our media servers

h3. Expected Results
- Images should be displayed to the user

h3. Actual Results
- Images are missing, just a placeholder of it is displayed.

h3. Workaround
As listed on the bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-54912, we have a workaround that needs to be applied by support team
fields.summary: JWT token expiring for images on Media Server

fields.description:
*Summary*

Not all task list added in table cells are saved. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new table
 # Add task list in each cell
 # Publish the page
 # Notice that only the tasks in some cells were saved random, and not all tasks were saved**

*Expected Results*

All tasks should be saved.

*Actual Results*

Only tasks in some cells were saved random, not all tasks list in all cells.

*Notes*

*Workaround*

I couldn’t find any workaround.
fields.summary: Task list added in table cells are saved randomly

fields.description:
h3. Summary In the Confluence Editor, If you color-format a line of text and then copy-paste that line of text, the color formatting "" will not close until just before the close of the last paragraph. This causes the "" tags to stack up and eventually renders the editor useless. Once published, the page displays no immediate symptoms, but when trying to edit, the editor will be impossibly slow and can be impacted such that the draft never loads. h3. Environment (Optional - If Applicable) Cloud. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page with a line of text and apply a color to the whole line of text and publish. # Edit the page again and copy the whole line of colored text. # Paste the line in new lines (as new paragraphs is confirmed to cause the problem, so just use Return and not Shift-Return) repeatedly. # Eventually, the page will publish on it's own out of nowhere, or you can publish the page after you have 10 - 20 lines pasted. h3. Expected Results The Storage format contains lines with discreet color formatting, or a single color formatting span is intelligently placed. h3. Actual Results When viewing the storage format, you will see all the text is lost in a sea of color formatting span tags, and just before the last ending "

" tag you will see something like this: {noformat} {noformat} h3. Notes Changing the color formatting of the affected text does not remove the bad spans. h3.Workaround The only known workaround at this time is to copy and paste the text into an editor that does not support the color, (such as notepad) and then to copy paste out of that editor, back into confluence to remove the color formatting.
fields.summary: Copy-Paste Colored Text in editor causes stacking Spans to accumulate and makes the editor unusable

fields.description:
Backups created using "Backup manager" for site "mycompany.atlassian.net" are impossible to restore to the same site due to limitation:

_"Site import isn't available for Atlassian Cloud sites with both Confluence and Jira (it works for Confluence-only sites)"_

Moreover - I can't restore a single space from that backup file!!!

My question is: what is the point to create a useless backup functionality? We have Jira + Confluence site so if I understand it properly we won't be able to restore the backup! I know that we can export spaces one by one but doing this every week is so time consuming and you are not helping us by not giving any API to automate this.

So what should I do now to test my Confluence_site.zip backup, dear ladies and gentleman from Atlassian, to be sure that data are really backup up and I will eventually restore them to my production instance? Create a new, "Confluence-only" instance called "mycompany-1.atlassian.net", import the data, export space one-by-one and import them to another (this time Jira+Confluence) site called "mycompany-2.atlassian.net"?

I would be so grateful if you can choose at least one of the following fix suggestions:
 # I can restore just one space from the entire backup (so eventually I'll restore all the spaces one-by-one)
 # I can execute a bulk spaces export (separate zip file for every space will be created)
 # Expose and API so I can write the point 2 on my own

 

Best regards
fields.summary: Improve backup functionality because now it is useless.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the iOS Confluence Cloud app there is no functionality to connect to the new [iOS Files App|https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT206481]. This app allows you to manage attachments elsewhere, including many file storage applications but even with other Cloud services such as Adobe Creative Cloud

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful to be able to manage Confluence attachments in this way as well.

h3. Why this is important
Further functionality to work and collaborate within iOS
fields.summary: Provide support for iOS Files app for Confluence iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a large space to PDF, the duration of the export is longer than the time between releases. When releases occur, the instance is restarted and temporary files are flushed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Identify a large space on instance (~1k+ pages)
# Attempt an export

h3. Expected Results
Export should successfully complete

h3. Actual Results
Export fails


h3.Workaround
From previous investigation: 

The way the upload here works is:
1) We export the content to HTML
2) We convert the HTML to PDF – by writing a temporary PDF file out to disk
3) We upload the PDF from disk to Media Services
It looks like the temporary PDF file on disk has been deleted by the time we try to upload it to Media Services. 
If we're doing a restart/upgrade of the instance during the export, it's possible that this is wiping out the temp file. Or perhaps there's another scheduled job which wipes it out. [...] we should probably avoid writing the temporary PDF file out to disk. 

We have another technique where we write the file directly to Media Services, and this should resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Export of large spaces to PDF times out

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Learn More" link in a Jira Issue macro points to a "Page Not Found" error. By checking the URL of the errored page, you can see that there is a reference to the instance itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Issue macro;
# Insert a wrong JQL to trigger the warning with the "Learn More" link;
# Click on the link.

h3. Expected Results
* Link to a page with assistance to Jira Issue macro.

h3. Actual Results
* The page returns a "Page Not Found" error. 
* If your instance URL is _https://example.atlassian.net_, it will return the following URL when you click the "Learn More" link: _https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KEY/pages/edit/Jira+Issues+Macro_
 
h3. Notes
* Closed bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-54586
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro's "Learn More" redirects to "Page Not Found"

fields.description:
I tried to register a bug because Confluence server wont' start after upgrade to latest version. But I am unable to do that using JIRA. It complains about no assign privileges. Also components looks miserable.

Note: I tested it in identical environment but this does help with this buggy software. It is expensive but still crap.

It might be an idea to use a working ticket tracker. Something else than Jira because I can even report critical bugs.
fields.summary: Use a ticket tracker like bugzilla

fields.description: Now JIRA Issue/Filter macro shows just the key to linked issues. We would like to have summary for linked issue too. It will have big value for us.
fields.summary: Summary for linked issue in JIRA Issue/Filter Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Site import with backup generated from Confluence cloud instance failed with the following error

{code}
msg:com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.UserNotFoundException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"404","detail":"A user with <userid> doesn't exists","errorType":"UserDoesNotExist","message":"A user with <userid> doesn't exists","data":"<userid>"}	
{code}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform site import with affected backup file
# Site import failed with "A user with <userid> doesn't exists"

h3. Expected Results
# Site import completed successfully

h3. Actual Results
# Failed import with "errorType":"UserDoesNotExist" error

h3.Workaround
Relocate all group membership after the user declaration 

Group Memberships
{code}
<object class="HibernateMembership" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2">
</object>
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence Site Import failed due to entities.xml generated contains group memberships that  are declared before the user declaration in the XML file
Whitelist /plugins/servlet/remotepageview endpoint for AC add-ons

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing any Confluence page in Safar, the CPU utilization of the thread running that tab will hold the running CPU core at 100% for several seconds. This does not happen when using other browsers like Chrome.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Safari Version 11.0.2 (12604.4.7.1.4)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In Safari, browse to any Confluence page and take note of the thread that is running the tab in the activity monitor.

h3. Expected Results
The Browser thread to consume a nominal amount of CPU (for example Chrome jumps up to about 25% for less than a second.

h3. Actual Results
 You will see it jump and hold at 100% for several seconds after loading the page.
 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
Currently the only workaround is to use another browser such as FireFox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Confluence Consumes 100% of the running CPU Core when running in Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The edit buttons fail in Confluence pages intermittently. When clicking on the edit button (pencil icon), it stays selected and just hangs. If the page is refreshed, you're redirected to a blank (white) page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Edit pages on a Confluence instance by clicking on the edit button. As the issue is intermittent, it might take some time to trigger this behavior.

h3. Expected Results
The edit mode opens.

h3. Actual Results
* Edit button stay selected but does not redirect to edit mode;
 !edit_button.png|thumbnail! 
* If the page is reloaded it will display a blank page;
 !blank.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page until it enters in edit mode
fields.summary: Edit button failing intermittently on pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With a file (tested with PDF) uploaded to a page and after inserted on the space homepage with the Insert Files and Images (Plus sign button > Files and Images) functionality, the file will display the thumbnail but won't open properly, as shown below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-07 at 17.05.23.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Upload a file (tested with PDF) to a page
 * Edit the space homepage and use the Insert Files and Images (Plus sign > Files and Images) functionality on the Space's homepage to link that file
 * Save the space homepage
 * Try to open the file clicking on the thumbnail on the space's homepage

h3. Expected Results
 * The file opens and its contents are displayed

h3. Actual Results
 * Error shown: "The file cannot be displayed \ Error: The file does not exist" ;

h3. Workaround
 * Re-upload the file to the Space Homepage instead of using the Insert Files and Images functionality.
fields.summary: File uploaded to a page and linked to the Space Homepage won't open on the homepage

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When editing a page, and clicking on *Insert more content > Other Macros*, there is a big delay until the panel opens up. It can take from 5 to 20 seconds.

h3.Steps to replicate
As described above, just click on the *Insert more content > Other Macros*. The issue seems to be intermittent but has started since the rollout of the new Editor for Confluence.
fields.summary: Big delay when trying to open "Other Macros" panel in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to create multiple-row tables using autoformatting by typing or pasting text tables.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table by typing the first row and pressing enter
# The editor creates the table and does not allow to create a second row using text.

# Create a table by pasting text and pressing enter
# After you hit enter it will create separate tables
 
h3. Expected Results
Multi-row tables are created

h3. Actual Results
Sigle line tables are created and they can't be joined up. 

h3. Workaround
* Create multi-row tables using the editor tools;
* In order to join up tables, cut each independent table row and paste it into the next.
fields.summary: Creating multi rows tables using autoformatting is not possible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a site import, if the user performing the import has a different username set on the source instance and on the destination instance, the import operation will fail with the error *User should not be null*.
The progress bar of the site import will reach 100% and starts removing the imported content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import a site backup on a new Confluence Cloud instance. Usernames must be different between the source instance and the destination instance for the user performing the import.

h3. Expected Results
The import completes properly.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails but still reaches 100%. The following error is thrown in Confluence logs:
{noformat}
	 msg:	 User should not be null	
    	 stack:	 java.lang.NullPointerException: User should not be null
	at java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:228)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.atlassianuser.EmbeddedCrowdGroupManager.getCrowdUser(EmbeddedCrowdGroupManager.java:181)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.atlassianuser.EmbeddedCrowdGroupManager.addMembership(EmbeddedCrowdGroupManager.java:137)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour is often encountered as when creating a new Cloud instance to perform a site import, the default username is *admin* while the user performing the import is not always the original creator on the source instance. Therefore the usernames differ.

h3.Workaround
Change your username to the one used in the source instance and perform the import once again.

*EDIT*:
As usernames are no longer changeable, if you encounter this issue, invite a new user that was a site administrator on your source instance with the same email address. This user should be able to perform the import.
fields.summary: Site import failing with error message "User should not be null" when the username is different between the source and destination instance for the importer

fields.description:
I have a problem with searching pages in the Confluence Cloud.

 

When I find the page named "과밀억제권역 법인설립 세금문제" with the keyword "과밀억제", I can't find it.

 

There is a difference between the Korean and other languages. In English, all the words are separated in the single word. But in Korean, some words are combined with others.

For example,

English: There is a difference between the Korean and other languages.

Korean: Theris adifference betweentheKoreanandotherlanguages.

 

Because of the difference, I can't find the page named above with the single keyword like "Korean".

 

To solve it, many Korean software Engineers adopt the Korean Analyzer for Lucene.

[https://github.com/HowookJeong/elasticsearch-analysis-arirang]

 

If you adopt it to your service, many Korean users are really appreciated for it.
fields.summary: Implement the Korean Language Analyzer into the Lucene.

fields.description:
h3.Summary
The "locker" icon on Page Restrictions does not reflect what is in the documentation. Based on the [Add or Remove Page Restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-or-remove-page-restrictions-724764891.html] documentation, the locker should be *red* when restricting the view of the page. 

If the user goes to the Restrictions panel on any page, the "View Restricted" lock is greyed out, instead of red. It is known that, if a page has a parent page with restrictions applied to it, its child pages should display the locker icon as red, since the restrictions are inherited. But still, if a page has *view* restrictions, the lock icon should be red as well, in order to differ from the unrestricted page.

h3.Steps to replicate
Steps to replicate:
# Set view restrictions on a parent page so that only certain users can view the page.
# Go to a child page. Result: The icon is grey.
# Click the icon and then click Cancel. Result: The icon is red.
fields.summary: Locker icon in Page Restrictions

fields.description:
Currently users with admin privileges on spaces are able to enable permission for exporting content, even if it was removed from them by site-admins. 

In order to prevent unwanted appropriation of content on Confluence, it would be helpful if exporting could be disabled for everyone except site-admins, without the possibility for them to recover this permission.
fields.summary: Create a method to disable exports for customers that are not site-admins

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding an align [wiki markup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Confluence+Wiki+Markup] in Custom Header/Footer in Space Tools > Look and Feel > Header and footer 

The alignment of the header/footer is still fixed to the center

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an align [wiki markup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Confluence+Wiki+Markup] in Custom Header/Footer in Space Tools > Look and Feel > Header and footer 
# For example {code}!HEADER RIGHT|align=right!{code}

h3. Expected Results
Header will change to the right

h3. Actual Results
Header will center

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Allow Custom Header and Footer to align using Wiki Markup

fields.description:
Currently the fuzzy search in the Confluence live search macro requires the adding of wildcard characters for search terms shorter than 4 letters. In languages other than English, this causes more searches without results.

Could the limit of the search search terms be reduced to 3 when the language in Confluence is set to something other than English?
fields.summary: Improve fuzzy search in Confluence live search macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Completing tasks from the *Task Report Macro* does not yield the correct results. Sometimes the task checked is not marked as complete after refreshing the page in the *Task report macro*.
Other times, the wrong tasks are marked as complete (mark 1 task as complete but other tasks are marked as complete on a different page instead) and the user cannot check/uncheck the same in the original page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Mark a task as complete from the *Task Report Macro* or from the My Tasks page in your Confluence User Profile
# Check the page where the tasks is located.

h3. Expected Results
The task is properly marked as complete all the time.

h3. Actual Results
The task is not marked as complete and other tasks on the space are marked as such. 
OR
No tasks are marked as complete at all.
 
h3. Notes
* This issue is triggered randomly.
* It also happens with single tasks added to pages
* Sometimes, the following message is displayed when trying to check a task:
{quote}
Oops! Your task change couldn't be saved. There could be a few reasons for this. Dismiss.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
For pages using the *Task Report Macro*. It might help with simple tasks as well.
# Open the page on which the phantom tasks appear
# Copy all of the content
# Delete the page
# Re-create it, and paste in the original content
fields.summary: Completing simple tasks or tasks from 'Task Report Macro' is unreliable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Smart Templates* macro from Vertuna does not receive any data from Confluence when the macro is placed inside a table.
Therefore, the data from the macro cannot be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the *Smart Templates for Confluence* add-on on your Confluence instance.
# Create a table on a page.
# Insert the *Smart Templates* macro in one of the table cells.
# Add a *Page tree* macro in any of the table cells.

h3. Expected Results
The *Smart Templates* macro displays the content properly.

h3. Actual Results
The *Smart Templates* macro does not display any data and the following error is thrown in the browser console:
{noformat}
batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:14 Uncaught Error: undefined missing ac/confluence/macro/property-panel-controls
    at s (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:14)
    at batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:15
{noformat}

Alex from Vertuna let us know that no data is received by the *Smart Templates* add-on in such cases.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
If you need to have the content displayed in the table, you will need to remove the *Page tree* macro from it.
fields.summary: 3rd party add-ons macros not receiving data and cannot display content when placed inside a table with a page tree

fields.description:
Hi,

We are Medical device company and looking for an document management tool.that help us to demonstrate *ISO 13485 and FDA 21 CFR*. compliance. We are already using Jira. 
 I understand Confluence is a tool that can be used for document management in which workflow is *not integrated* with the tool so that workflow can be set and document approval can be shown.


Please let's know confluence can be used to demonstrate ISO 13485 and FDA compliancy
 
 
OR
 
What is the option like any add-on we can adopted to demonstrate ISO 13485 and FDA and the pertaining details. 
 
Waiting for the urgent response
fields.summary: Looking Atlassian for Document control & Record management product

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Enter the editor
* Make the viewport small
* Place at the cursor at the top of the document
* Press { or [ to bring up the inline macro browser or link menus

Expected:
* The enter menu is visible and clickable, scrolling the viewport if necessary

Actual:
* Menu is placed such that the top extends off the viewport

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Navigate to Space Tools in a Cloud Environment, get to a 404 "Oops you've found a dead link"
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
*  Cloud
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Space in Confluence
# Click on Space Tools

h3. Expected Results
* Takes you to the Space Tools for the selected Space

h3. Actual Results
* Returns you to a 404, stating the link is dead
*  !404_message.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
* refreshing resolves the issue and page/space will continue to work as expected.

fields.description:
Hi all,

I use Confluence Cloud to write end-of-sprint reports.  I'd like to be able to include a created vs resolved chart for bugs to show the day-to-day count over the time of the sprint – but there doesn't seem to be a way to specify a start date and an end date.  Help?
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved Chart with historical data

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Customers receives the daily notification mail ("Confluence changes in the last 24 hours") even when they have not checked the "Subscribe to daily updates" option in their profile. They get 2 notification emails if the option is checked. 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Login as user@domain.com.
 # Go to Profile > Settings > Email > Edit.
 # Check the Subscribe to daily updates check box.
 # User gets 2 emails for "Confluence changes in the last 24 hours"
 # Uncheck the checkbox and see that user still gets one notification.

*Expected Results*
 * If the option "Subscribe to daily updates" is not checked, users should not get the daily digest mail
 * If the option "Subscribe to daily updates" is checked, users should get only one mail every day

*Actual results*
 * Users with "Subscribe to daily updates" option checked get 2 emails everyday
 * Other users also get the daily digest mails, even though they have not subscribed to the same
fields.summary: Duplicate notifications being sent for customers
Duplicate notifications being sent for customers

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
Some documents uploaded to Confluence may contain sensitive information about a company or product, it would be good to set a way to enforce users to insert a password when opening these documents attached.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide administrators a way to password secure documents attached to Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to set a way to password secure an attached document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45620].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

# Fields under JIRA Issue Macro is missing or isn't complete for Mobile view and Confluence Cloud iOS App compare, however, the all fields are visible through Desktop view: Currently, the Confluence iOS app shows couple of JIRA Issue Macro fields. eg. *Key, Summary and Status*
# Insight of the overall operations will be impacted as it is much easier to use the mobile app to see the complete information when on the go.

h3. Suggested Solution

Include all the fields as shown in the Desktop view into Mobile view and Confluence Cloud iOS App 

h3. Workaround
In order to view the remaining fields on iOS mobile without redirecting to the app, you would need to uninstall the Confluence Cloud iOS application and open the page in full desktop mode.
fields.summary: Missing JIRA Issue Macro Fields in Browser's Mobile view and Confluence Cloud iOS App
Internal Links with PageID in the URL's does not work after Cloud to Server Migration

fields.description:
The table toolbar in the new Editor is contextual and shows when you are in a table and hides otherwise.

On _some_ tables, when selecting multiple cells in order to merge, the toolbar will hide, making it impossible to merge cells. It is also impossible to copy/paste cells/rows on these tables.

It appears that this might only happen on some (but not all) tables that have been copied from View Mode. 

Workaround: Recreating the table in the editor does not exhibit the issue.
fields.summary: When selecting multiple cells on some tables, table toolbar hides which prevents cell merging

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to copy already created Task lists in Confluence and then, have it pasted in the editor, it will be converted into Bullet Points.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On any page, click to *edit* it
# Click on the *Task List* option, from the options of the editor
# Copy the created tasks
# Paste in the editor

h3. Expected Results
The Tasks should be pasted with the same content

h3. Actual Results
The Tasks are converted into Bullet Points:

!tasks.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Manually re-create the tasks.
fields.summary: Copying Task List Converts it Into Bullet Points

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

Accordantly to Confluence's [Save for later documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/save-for-later-724765402.html], this content is located/accessed under *Your work* menu located on the sidebar.

h2. Suggested Solution
Remove the *Saved for later* option which is listed when a user clicks on the profile picture, this can cause confusion and a bad experience to customers since the content is now accessed like described above.
fields.summary: Remove the "Saved for later"option listes when clicking on the user profile picture

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to integrate Confluence with distributed object store via Amazon S3 API for storing Confluence attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the ability to integrate Cloud application with Amazon S3
fields.summary: Add support for distributed object store via Amazon S3 API for storing Confluence attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When subscribing to a Google Calendar using the ics URL.
If you use the ICS url, Confluence will load in the calendar with only the events that were created by the owner of the calendar. Any events that were added to the calendar by other users will not show up in Confluence. If you use the same URL to download the ".ics" file, then import that information statically, then all the events will be loaded.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In your Google Calendar, share the calendar publicly then get the ICal calendar address.
# Subscribe to a calendar in team calendars while specifying the ICal URL in the previous step as the calendar address.

h3. Expected Results

All calendar events are loaded.

h3. Actual Results

Only calendar events that were created by the calendar owner are listed.

h3. Notes
Browsing directly to the Google Calendar ICS url will download a ".ics" file. Importing that as the calendar will import all of the events as expected, however this method is static.

h3.Workaround
There are currently no known workarounds at this time.
fields.summary: Team Calendars that are subscribed to a Google Calendar do not pull in Events created by others.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate

# Upload attachment into a page
# Go to the attachment page
# Move the divider between navigation panel and page body, 




h3. Observed Behaviour

Only the FileName column of the attachments grid is resized (width).


h3. Expected behaviour

The filename column should not resize like other columns (e.g Size, creator)
fields.summary: Attachment Name column does not have fix width

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When previewing a draft that has not been published yet (page/blog post does not exist), the top of the page is not visible and user cannot scroll to access it.
The page title is not visible for smaller page.
The toolbar is still displayed as well when in preview.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start to create a new page/blog post.
# Preview the page.

h3. Expected Results
The page is previewed with the page title visible and the toolbar is removed.

h3. Actual Results
The page is previewed with the top of the page missing if the page has a lot of content.
If the page can be displayed in one page, the page title will be missing.
In both cases, the toolbar is still present in the preview mode:
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-30 at 10.26.55.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
You will need to first publish the page to preview it fully. You can apply restrictions to the page before publishing it if you do not want any one to see the page before it is ready.
fields.summary: Top of the page is not visible when previewing a non yet created page/blog post

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After generating a backup in Confluence Cloud, if the backup file is huge, the download may fail randomly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup in Cloud.
# Download the backup file

h3. Expected Results
The download should proceed until it finishes.

h3. Actual Results
The download will end randomly and the backup file size is not downloaded fully.
The download dies before completing. Sometimes it looks like it finished successfully as it doesn't through an error in the browser while downloading but the download file isn't complete.

Error message thrown by the browser when the backup fails
{noformat}
{
error: {
code: "JwtAuthoriser:TokenExpiredError",
title: "Token verification failed: jwt expired",
href: "https://media-api.atlassian.io#UnauthorizedError"
}
}
{noformat}

h2. Workaround
Use the Google Chrome browser to perform the download (instead of Internet Explorer or FireFox or whatever else you're using)

Please let us know if the workaround does not work.
fields.summary: Downloads are failing for very large backups for customers
Duplicated macro name causing issues on Confluence Cloud
Allow CQ to pre fill fields when creating a question via deep linking

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, if the user does have the *Add Page* permission on the space, the same will be able to access the *Space Tools > Content Tools > Reorder Pages* option, which allows the same to configure the order that the pages will be displayed in its tree.

However, if the user does not have permission to edit/view a specific page from the space, if the same tries to use the *alphabetical reorder option*, it will not work. It displays at it worked, but, once the reorder page is refreshed, the change will not take effect. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a space, make sure to have a page restricted to a user that will not execute the reorder action
# Once you have the page restricted, log in as a user that does not have permission to access the same
# Go to *Space Tools > Content Tools > Reorder Pages*
# Make sure to manually reorder a page to a non-alphabetical order, so the option to reorder alphabetically will be displayed
# Try to click on the alphabetical reorder option and then, refresh the page/come back to the page

h3. Expected Results
The page should be reordered properly, or a message that the user is not permitted do to it should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results
No changes are taken.
 
h3. Notes
Manually moving the pages work. Only the alphabetical reorder option does not work, as displayed in the screenshot below:

!alpha.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Manually move the page.

h3. Scope of ticket
Add a message that the user did not have permission to reorder alphabetically eg "reorder by alphabetical sorting failed as you do not have edit permissions on some pages in the tree".
Content of message to be run by content design.
fields.summary: Reorder Pages Does Not Work If User does Not Have Permission to All Pages

fields.description:
*Summary*

Cannot add bullets/numbers inside Info, Tip, Note, and Warning Macros within a bullet list/number list 

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Edit a page
 # Add a bullet list/numbered list
 # Within one line of the bullet list/numbered list add an Info, Tip, Note and Warning macros
 # Notice that you cannot add a new bullet list/numbered list inside the inserted macro

 

*Expected Results*

We should be able to add a bullet list/numbered list inside the macro added within the initial list.

*Actual Results*

We are not able to add a bullet list/numbered list inside the macro added within the initial list.

 

*Notes*

 This is an issue only when these macros are added inside a bullet list/numbered list.

*Workaround*

Copy the bullet list/numbered outside the macro, within the macro and edit the content.
fields.summary: Cannot add bullets/numbers inside Info, Tip, Note, and Warning Macros within a bullet list/number list

fields.description:
Try pasting this link on a comment... https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=labels%20%3D%20people_directory%20and%20status%20not%20in%20(Resolved%2C%20closed)

You just get a loading throbber when you save and it never loads
fields.summary: pasting a link to a list of Jira issues no longer renders in comments in cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you are viewing a question in Questions for Confluence, there is a list of Related Questions on the right side. If you open any of these links in a new tab or window, the page does not load and reports a 404 not found in the form of JSON.

Clicking the link normally will load the question in the current page, seemingly in-place without reloading the page.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View any question in Questions for Confluence that has populated "Related Questions".
# Right-click a related question link and open in new tab.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads in the new tab.

h3. Actual Results
The new tab returns a 404 and gives a JSON data response like this:
{noformat}
{"status":404,"error":"Not Found","message":"No message available","timeStamp":"Tue Nov 28 18:15:49 UTC 2017","trace":null}
{noformat}

h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
Create a duplicate tab of the current question that you are on, then clicking the link you want to open as a new tab.
fields.summary: Related Questions links in Questions for Confluence return 404 when opened in new tab/window

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Google Chrome's spellchecker does not work on Meeting Notes pages blueprints.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using Chrome, create a Meeting Note page in Confluence
 # On the editor, add any misspelled word 

h3. Expected Results

Google Chrome spellchecker should mark in red all misspelled/unknown words

h3. Actual Results

Google Chrome's spellchecker stop working
  
h3. Workaround
Use other [Confluence supported browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html] like Firefox or Safari.
fields.summary: Google Chrome's spellchecker doesn't work on Meeting Notes page blueprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user sets a page as the favorite based on the *type of document*, the URL of Landing Page will change.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new *documentation* space
# You'll notice that the *Overview* page is hidden in this blueprint, click on the *Pencil Icon* on the bottom of the Space Sidebar and choose to *Display* the *Overview* page
# Under *Space Tools* set the Landing Page of the Space as the *Overview* (Documentation default is the *Page Tree*)
# Access the Space, and successfully land on the *Overview Page*
# Go to *Spaces*
# Under *Categories*, on the left side, click on *Documentation*
# Find the newly created Space and click on the *Star Icon* to set it as your favorite
# Go to the home page of the site
# On the Sidebar, click on your new *Favorite* space

h3. Expected Results
You will land on the configured *Landing Page of the Space*

h3. Actual Results
You will be redirected to the *Page Tree*, instead of the Landing Page.

h3. Notes
This behavior does not occur if you set the Space as a favorite from the *All Spaces* tab in the *Space Directory*, nor if you access the space from somewhere else other than your favorite spaces in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Setting a Space as your favorite, based on its category on Space directory, overwrites landing page configuration

fields.description:
When Sufficient changes to a page shared draft are made, it can cause a great deal of confusion where users are not sure if the missing content is due to changes made by a particular user. Even with the current widgets, the fact that changes have been made to the page, and what specific changes were made could be improved to help users more intuitively understand that the nature of the changes made by other users.

I would personally like to recommend text Highlighting for newly added text, and a marker to indicate that content has been removed relative to the last published page.
fields.summary: Improve Visibility of Edits in Shared Draft

fields.description:
You can copy any page and change title, content, space, parent pages etc. before publishing. 

The same is not possible for blog posts / news at the moment. 

Please give users the ability to copy a blog post just like he or she can copy a page.
fields.summary: Copy blog posts like you copy pages
Change the naming of Meeting Notes to the Singular instead of plural

fields.description:
Template "Meeting notes"
Enable the change the name of the meeting notes template, because they are translated in prulal ({color:#FF0000}"Minutas{color} de 25-11-2017").
fields.summary: Request improvements "Change the name of blueprint templates".
